ideology.name: antiauthoritarianism
ideology.description: A radical philisopy that advocates self-governed societies based on voluntary institutions which denies authority of law and lawmakers.

ideology.name: centrism
ideology.description: A political view that involves acceptance or support of a balance of a degree of social equality and a degree of social hierarchy.

ideology.name: conservatism
ideology.description: A political belief that favors conservation of cultural and/or religious values and praises traditional view in lawmaking.

ideology.name: enviromentalism
ideology.description: An ideology regarding concerns for environmental protection and improvement of the health of the environment, particularly as the measure for this health seeks to incorporate the impact of changes to the environment on the planet.

ideology.name: liberalism
ideology.description: A political view based on liberty and equality which supports civil rights, democracy, secularism, gender equality, internationalism and the freedoms of speech, the press, religion and markets.

ideology.name: nationalism
ideology.description: A political system characterized by promoting the interests of a particular nation particularly with the aim of gaining and maintaining full sovereignty over the group's homeland.

ideology.name: religionism
ideology.description: A view that upholds religious laws and determining a state's laws by majority religion in that state.

ideology.name: republicanism
ideology.description: An ideology centered on citizenship in a state organized as a republic under which the people hold popular sovereignty, which upholds that majority's favor is always the best.

ideology.name: socialism
ideology.description: A social and political system characterised by social ownership and democratic control of the means of production as well as the political theories and movements associated with them.
